transcription_telugu: Baharthadeism lo vidyapaytelego präsengam Manilaena adhyakshilagari ki upadhyayalu Senehitalu mariyuna Priyamayna sahacharlandir ki Naarudeya purva ka namaskaralu Irojna koichna i apurvamayna vakasa ni Ne ne yentu gaura vanga svikaristunanu Manan chacincya boye amsam Baharthadeism lo vidyya Oka jatiya paranga yentu muka minadi Sama jikanga yentu prabhao vantamayna di Vidyya yokka pramo kita Vidyya ne edu oka vyakti ni maanavodiga tiirsi di desekti Adi kevalam pushta ka pugnaaname ka dhu Adi alochin chacesei sekti Tar kikata, naiti kata Sama jempat labha jeta Manam aha nubha valu cepinatlu Vidyya le ni de vi mukti le dhu Vidyya mana ji vita ni veligunis te Desam yo kabhavi shetnu Ghaadhanga prabhavi tan sesthindi Baharthadeism lo vidyya vivaasta Baharthadeism vidyya lo Abhi vruti cendutunna desa lo oka ti Swatintram pandinatar vata Hanayka vidyya samskara nalutis kuchamu Pradamika vidynu Anni pillala ko anda batalokite evada me moda ti laksim Rajiv Gandhi vidyya mission Sarvasikshabhiyan Madyahna bojanna pathakalu vantipathakalu Vidyya nu pehdala ko koda cerva che saai Iti valikalallu Nuthanav vidyya vidyya vitha nam rendu vela ira vai NEP2020 Baharthadev vidyya vavasthanu Purtis thaylo maliputippe vidhingga Rupundin chabadindi Idi patesala stayinunchi Onnata vidyya stayvaraku Anayka nuthanav markadarsakala nu amli cestundi Kriyasilav vidyya Talibashalav vidyya Project Basic Learning Modalainavi Ippati ki onnasa valu Aiti manam inkapalisama syalanu iidru kuntunnam Grammina prantallav vidyya rabheta inka caala gramalalu sarayna patesala lu Upadhyaylu vasatanu levu Lingavi vaksita Alikala kuinka kuntichotla Chadhu apestinaru Adhika samasyalu Peda kuntunvalu thama pillan lichaadvinçalaya kapotinaru Nanya talu lovom Kunti patesala lu bodhana pramanalu Chaala takoga onnayi Digital vibajana Kovid samayallo ivishiya marintas pashtanga kana pincindi Online vidyya andariki ceralaydu Parishkaramaargalu Iisamaasyala kunti parishkaralumana kuunnayi Prabhutva madhethu Grammina vidyya nu balo pethan cerali Balika la vidyya nu praca hinsiindaku Pratya kuntitlu keta inkaali Upadhyayas siksana pa ekku odrustipetali Digital patesala lu Tablet lu Internet sada paialu Andariki anda batlu onnayali Vidyya lov samanathu onkosam Samajikanga prajallu ceritanjim raavali Upasam haram Chivariga vidyya nedi okamana vahaku Prativokkaru Manam chadivite kewalam mana jivita me kado Manakutumbam samajam desang kodai dukutandi Vidyya mana desang ni viso gurustai kiti iskuvallagalge pradhanasikti Manamanta kala si vidyya bihrit dikosam kruşitce dham Pratiokkaru ki chadu andela chuse dham Chadu umita premanu abhimara ni pincinth dham Thanya vada lu Jayhint Jay Bharath
translation_english:
Respected President, teachers, friends, and dear colleagues, a warm welcome to you all. I humbly and respectfully accept this unique opportunity to speak. The topic we are going to discuss is the significance of education in India, its role as a national asset, and its social impact. The power of education, what makes a person human, is not just bookish knowledge. It is the power to think, reason, and develop morality and empathy. As many great people have said, without education, there is no liberation. Education illuminates our lives and profoundly shapes the future of the country.

The education system in India is vast. India is a developing country making progress in education. Since independence, many educational reforms have been implemented. Providing primary education to all children has been a primary goal. Rajiv Gandhi's Education Mission, Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (Education for All), and Mid-day Meal schemes are some examples of initiatives taken to make education accessible to the poor as well. More recently, the New Education Policy 2020 (NEP2020) has been formulated to completely reshape the Indian education system. It implements several new guidelines from the school level to higher education, including activity-based learning, tablet-based learning, and project-based learning.

However, we still face many problems. Education in rural areas is lagging; many villages lack proper schools and teachers. Gender discrimination still exists; girls drop out of school due to various reasons. Poverty prevents many parents from sending their children to school. The quality of many schools and teaching standards are very low. The digital divide became even more apparent during the COVID pandemic. Online education did not reach everyone.

Solutions exist to address these problems. The government should focus on strengthening rural education. Special initiatives should be taken to promote girls' education. Greater emphasis should be placed on teacher training. Digital schools, tablets, and internet access should be made available to all. The public should come together to strive for equality in education.

In conclusion, education is a powerful tool. If we educate ourselves, not only will our lives improve, but also the lives of our families, society, and the country. Education is the main force that will make our country a global leader. Let us all work together for the betterment of education. Let's make education accessible to everyone. Let's instill love and respect for learning. Thank you. Jai Hind! Jai Bharat!
